intro: Jungia fistulosa, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small showers. The plant has compound leaves and produces long, pendulous clusters of flowers, which bloom throughout the year in warm climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Jungia fistulosa is adaptable to various soil types but thrives best in well-drained, sunny locations.
